titles.title: Dǝggwa, Antiphonary / Ṣomä dǝggwa, Antiphonary for Lent

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dǝggwa, Antiphonary (from the feast of St. John the Baptist to the feast of Simon, 8 Yäkkatit) (fols. 5r-98v) - Ṣomä dǝggwa, Antiphonary for Lent (fols. 99ra-120v) II) Dǝggwa, Antiphonary (from Easter to the end of the liturgical year) (fols. 121r-172v)
Additiones 1-10; colophon.

originlink.xlink:title: ʿAddigrat Däbrä Mänkәrat Qәddus Qirqos / AMQ

locationlink.xlink:title: ʿAddigrat Däbrä Mänkәrat Qәddus Qirqos / AMQ

copyists.copyist: Kǝflä Maryam of Däbrä Libanos is mentioned in the colophon as the one who “arranged” (śärʿo) the collection (equivalent to scribe, hand a?) of the text on fols. 5r-120v (quires I-XV).

owners.owner: The original owner, Zä-Wäldä Maryam, is mentioned in the colophon. Later, the Ms. was in the possession of Maḫbärä Maryam Däbrä ʾAbunä ʾIyosyas (probably ʾƎnda ʾAbunä ʾIyosyas Lägomti, near ʿAdwa). In 1896 it was purchased by the church of ʿAddigrat Qirqos.

dcomments.dcomment: According to the colophon (for fols. 5r-120v) the Ms. was written in the month of Taḫśas 1753 year of mercy (= 1760 A.D.), in the 6th year of the reign of King ʾIyoʾas (r. 1755-69). Fols. 121r-172v (quires XVI-XXII) date back to approximately the same period.

txstates.txstate: The dark brown leather cover is for the most part missing. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 11, 19, 35, 48, 74, 86, 107, 108, 111, 140, 158, 174, 175.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather (for the most part missing, only turn-ins have been preserved); textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations. Quires X and XXII are reinforced by parchment guards.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather turn-ins (at least 1 tool was used: double line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Two rows of small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires.

inks.ink: Black, red (vivid red in fols. 5r-120v, vivid vermilion in fols. 121r-172v)

squires.squire:
A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – II(8/fols. 13r-20v) – III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) – V(8/fols. 37r-44v) – VI(8/fols. 45r-52v) – VII(8/fols. 53r-60v) – VIII(8/fols. 61r-68v) – IX(8/fols. 69r-76v) – X(8/fols. 77r-84v) – XI(8/fols. 85r-92v) – XII(6/fols. 93r-98v) – XIII(8/fols. 99r-106v) – XIV(8/fols. 107r-114v) – XV(6/fols. 115r-120v) – <XVI(8/fols. 121r-128v) – XVII(8/fols. 129r-136v) – XVIII(8/fols. 137r-144v) – XIX(8/fols. 145r-152v) – XX(8/fols. 153r-160v) – XXI(8/fols. 161r-168v) – XXII(4/fols. 169r-172v)> – B1(3; s.l.: 3, stub before 1/fols. 173r-175v) – B2(4/fols. 176r-179v).
Most probably, two sets of quires A-XV (and B1) and XVI-XXII were at some point bound together. The fols. in second set of quires have more ruled lines. Quire B2 was probably added later. Its fols. are smaller, of different quality and have fewer ruled lines.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/A. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Second half of the 18th century, rounded broad script.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: fine and careful. Hand b: fine and careful.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 5r-120v Hand b: fols. 121r-172v

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the king, the scribe and the owner; a few lines in the colophon (alternating with black lines); a few lines in the incipit page of Texts I-II and on fol. 53r; names of sections followed by the feast name and initial words or lines (e.g., bä-maḫtǝwä ʾƎsṭifanos, wazema zä-Zäkaryas tänäbäyä laʿǝlä wäldu Yoḥannǝs wä-yǝbe); names of antiphons and their abbreviations (e.g., maḫlet, mäzmur, śäläst, sälam, bä-5-tu, ʾabun, ʾaryam, ʾǝsmä lä-ʿaläm, kwǝllǝkkǝmu, zä-ʾamlakiyä, zä-yǝʾǝze, yǝtbaräk); names of other chants and their abbreviations (e.g., mǝlṭan, mǝsbak, mǝqnay, mǝdgam, qǝnnǝwat, ʿǝzl); musical notation: intratextual signs (e.g., ʿararat, ʾaklilä, bä-zemahu, ḥaḍä, wäy, yǝgäbru, ʾaryam qädami zema) and marginal signs; elements of the Table of halleluiatic chants; red and black dot chains separating groups of antiphons belonging to different liturgical hours within the same day; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

abbreviations.abbreviation:
ም፡/ምል፡/ምልጣ፡ for ምልጣን፡ ማ፡/ማኅ፡/ማኅሌ፡ for ማኅሌት፡ ምድ፡/ምድጋ፡ for ምድጋም፡ መዝ፡/መዝሙ፡ for መዝሙር፡ ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ ስብ፡/ስብሐ፡ for ስብሐተ፡ ነግህ፡ ትጉ፡ for ትጉሃን፡ ይትባ፡ for ይትባረክ፡ ቅን፡/ቅንዋ፡ for ቅንዋት፡ ቃለ፡ ዓ፡ for ቃለ፡ ዓዋዲ፡ ዋዜ፡ for ዋዜማ፡ ዘአምላ፡ for ዘአምላኪየ፡ እስመ፡ ለዓ፡ for እስመ፡ ለዓለም፡ አር፡ for አርያም፡ አቡ፡ for አቡን፡ ዕዝ፡ for ዕዝል፡ ሃ፡ for ሃሌሉያ፡ ዮሐ፡/ዮሐን፡ for ዮሐንስ፡
Repeated versicles are often written in an abbreviated form, e.g., ጥ፤ ጕ፤ ከ፤ ወ፤ stands for ጥዑም፡ ጕርዔሁ፡ ከመ፡ ወይን፡ (fol. 31rb l.33). Hand a uses more abbreviations than hand b.

colophon.det: The colophon is placed before the main text. According to the colophon, the collection was “arranged” (śärʿo) by Kǝflä Maryam of Däbrä Libanos, the attendant of the treasury (gǝmğa bet), for Zä-Wäldä Maryam in the 6th (or 7th) year of the reign of King ʾIyoʾas (r. 1755-69). The book was written in the 5500 year of punishment and 1753 year of mercy (= 1761 A.D.), and completed on 3rd Taḫśaś, Wednesday, at 3 o’clock, in the night 28, ʾabäqte (epact) 23, mäṭqǝʿ 7, in the year of Matthew the Evangelist. Also, it mentions King Gäbrä Mäsqäl, during whose reign the book is thought to be prepared, and ʾabba Yoḥannǝs, the 31st abbot of Däbrä Libanos.

additional.cont: Fol. 4r (above): Excerpt from an unidentified prayer to St. Mary.
additional.det: The note is written in a very fine hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 4r (below): Unidentified prayer for the feast of Hosaˁəna (Palm Sunday).
additional.det: The note is written in the same fine hand as Additio 9.

additional.cont: Fol. 4r (above to the right): Qǝne-poem (?).
additional.det: It is carelessly written in a mediocre hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 52ra: Note on donating liturgical vestments.
additional.det: The note is written in a mediocre hand; the names of the donor and the patron of the church are rubricated. The note mentions ʾabba Ḍädalä Śǝllase who donated to the church of ʾabba ʾIyosyas liturgical vestments (lǝbsä qǝddǝsat).

additional.cont: Fol. 52rbc: List of the heads (mämhǝran) of Maḫbärä Maryam Däbrä ʾAbunä ʾIyosyas.
additional.det: The list contains 29 names of the heads (mämhǝran), divided into two groups qädamawi and dagǝm (“first” and “second”) and 4 names of the high priests (liqä kahǝnat). Probably the last 3 names of the high priests and other 9 names written in col. c were added later. It is written by a fine and regular hand.
The note is written in a fine hand. The most important parts of the note have been erased. It mentions the seller ʾabba Sura<…>.

additional.cont: Fol. 175r (below): Purchase note.
additional.add: Fol. 175r: ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘአድ፡ ግራት፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ዘተሣየጣ፡ ቄስ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ በንዋየ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ፶፡ ብር፡ ሻጩ፡ ማኅበር፡ መምሕር፡ ኃይለ፡ ማርያም፡ አባ፡ ወልደ፡ ገሪማ፡ ባይቀማኝ፡ ተጫነው፡ አጽብሐ፥ አቶ፡ እንደሻው። ዳኛው፡ ደብተራ፡ ብርሃኑ፡ ሻጭ፥ በማኅበር፡ ፈቃድ፡ አባ፡ ፆታ፡ መድኅኑ፡ አቶ፡ እምባየ። እምደብረ፡ ኢዮስያስ፡ የተገዛ። አመ ፲ወ፮፡ ለነሐሴ። በ፸፻፡ ወ፫፻፡ ወ፰፡ ዓመት፡ እመአመ፡ ተፈጥረ፡ ዓለም፡ በዘመነ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወንጌላዊ። ንጉሥነሰ፡ ምንይልክ[sic]፡ ጣልያንን፡ ድል፡ በአደረጉ፡ ጊዜ፡ አመ፡ ፳ወ፫፡ ለየካቲት። በዕለተ፡ ሰንበት፡
additional.det: The note is written in Gǝʿǝz and Amharic in a fine hand. According to it, priest Täklä Haymanot bought the Ms. for 50 bǝrr on behalf of the community of Qirqos church in ʿAddigrat in 7308 year of the world (= 1808 A.D.), in the year of John, during the reign of King Mǝnǝlik. The sellers were ʾabba Ḍota Mädḫǝnu and ʾato ʾƎmbayyä, representing the monastery Däbrä ʾIyosyas. Additionally, the witnesses, the judge of the transaction and the battle of ʾAdwa, which took place in the same year, are mentioned. The two dates do not fit with each other because the scribe probably forgot to write number 80 before 8. This would give 7388 year of the world which corresponds to 1896 A.D. and the year of John when the battle of ʿAdwa took place.
The text mentions, among others, the story of Cain and Abel. It is written in a mediocre hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 175v (below): Unidentified prayer mentioning David.
additional.det: The prayer is probably written in the same fine hand as Additio 2.

additional.cont: Fol. 178r: Excerpt from Dǝggwa, Antiphonary, for the feast of the Heavenly Priests (zä-kahǝnatä sämay).
additional.det: The note is written in a fine hand. The script is conspicuously right sloping.

extras.extra: - Two titles of chant books, Ziq and Mǝʿǝraf, are written on the front board. - The title of the work is crudely written in red pen on fol. 1r. - A note in Arabic script is written upside down on fol. 1r. - Pen trials: fols. 48r, 149v (with the name of Ḍädalä Śǝllase, s. Additio IV), 175r, 175v. - A few lines of text in three columns, written in the same hand as Additio 1, have been erased from fol. 4v. - A few lines of a text have been erased from fol. 52rc. - A few lines of a text (mentioning the monastery Däbrä ʾIyosyas) have been erased from fol. 175v. - Omitted passages are written in the margins: fols. 23vc, 55rc, 57r, 58ab, 59rac, 60va, 62rbc, 63vac, 64vc, 68rabc, 68vabc, 70rabc, 74va, 83rbc, 85va, 105rb, 110rb, 121ra, 121vabc, 122rabc, 126rabc, 127vabc, 133vac, 135rc, 147rbc, 149vc, 153vb, 154rabc, 155rbc, 157rac. - Tämälläs-signs in the shape of a cross (+) indicate the place where the omissions, written in the margins, belong: fols. 8vb l.24, 9rb l.23, 25rc l.2, 28v l.25, 50vb l.3, 99rb l.12, 119ra l.21, 123ra l.16, 123rb l.9, 123rc l.23, 124rc l.8, 125ra l.14, 125vc l.24, 126vb l.17, 131rb l.5, 131vc l.15, 132vc l.5, 133rc l.33, 134ra l.22, 134vc l.16, 135ra l.3, 135vb l.21, 137rc l.29, 142rc l.7, 146rb l.33, 146va l.42, 147vc l.33, 148rc l.25, 148vc l.15, 149vb l.9, 149vb l.11, 150rc l.1, 150vc l.14, 152rb l.33, 153va l.19, 157va l.27, 157vc l.27, 159ra l.18. - Tämälläs-signs in the shape of ┴ indicate the place where the omissions, written in the margins, belong: fols. 14vc l.3, 20vc l.1, 23vb l.24, 25rc l.13, 46rc l.17, 51va l.19, 54vb l.5, 55va l.14, 57vc l.3, 58rb l.4, 64ra l.3, 65ra l.35, 65vb l.18, 69ra l.2, 77vc l.30, 77vc l.35, 94va l.19, 98rb l.8, 104va l.35, 114rb l.6, 115va l.26, 116va l.12, 143vc l.36, 154vc l.39, 157vb l.38, 159ra l.19, 160ra l.38, 160rb l.2, 160rc l.17, 160va l.17, 160vc l.32, 161ra l.5, 161ra l.10, 161vb l.11, 162vb l.28, 162vc l.29, 163rb l.2, 163vb l.5, 163vc l.27, 164rb l.40, 165vc l.39, 167vc l.6, 168rc l.1, 169ra l.14, 169ra l.16, 170rb l.31, 170rb l.39, 171vc l.3, 172ra l.9. - Signs, in the shape of a cross with a loop at the end of each arm, are written in the intercolumn and side margins: e.g., fols. 6r, 6v, 9v, 20r, 20v, 40r, 47v, 49v, 64r, 65v, 67v, 68r, 68v, 71r, 72v, 81r, 91r, 91v, 119r, 124r, 125r, 127r, 128r, 130r, 146v, 151v, 152r, 152v, 155v, 163v, 164r, 171r, 172v. - There are unfilled spaces left for rubrication on fols. 16rbc, 17rbc, 29vb, 34rc, 145rc and 150vb . - Minor notes, writing exercises, doodles: fols. 8r, 51r, 52r, 136v, 162r, 173r, 173v, 175v, 178v.

frames.frame: Fol. 5r: elaborate, coloured (red and black) ornamental frame; interlaces. Fols. 7va and throughout until 120v: Short ornamental bands dividing the texts into sections.
